instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Hi Everyone,

I have this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>;  no history,  no liquid.

itâ€™s not recognize in DFU/ Apple Configurator.
 
Reading on meter is 5V, ~0.455amp;  reading taking with board outside enclosure.


PPBus is fluctuating ~ 8v.

Slp and awake power is cycling from <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

I can not find any short anywhere.

I have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>,  but same result, still around 8v on ppbus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This is solved.  
Found <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>  fluctuating around 1.6V-1.7V  at L6960 and L6961.   After a closer look at <CHIP>U6960</CHIP>,  found corrosion on the outside of the chip.  Replace <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> and everything is good.
